lead_paragraph: While the French economy has become more open and competitive in recent decades, candidates’ proposals to ease labor laws, shrink the government and confront unions face resistance.

headline.print_headline: A Leading Candidate in France Is Intent on a Conservative Overhaul
headline.main: With Presidency in Play, Can France Embrace Economic Change?

snippet: While the French economy has become more open and competitive in recent decades, candidates’ proposals to ease labor laws, shrink the government and confront unions face resistance....
abstract: Francois Fillon, conservative politician running for president in France, outlines plan he says will liberalize nation's ailing economy; proposal to  loosen business regulations, make deep cuts in government jobs and stand up to labor unions threatens country's longstanding social model; Fillon is expected to face strong challenge from populist National Front candidate Marine Le Pen.
